website_summaries.verdict: Microsoft's Xbox 360 Quick Charge Kit is a must-have Xbox 360 accessory for those who already own--or are considering buying--a wireless controller.
pros: The Microsoft Xbox 360 Quick Charge Kit comes with one rechargeable battery for Xbox 360 wireless controllers and offers a much more practical solution than the Play and Charge Kit for juicing up your 360's wireless controllers
cons: At three hours for a recharge, it's pretty quick--but not that quick

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good deal, superb seller
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly as described. Plug and play except that for Win 7 it is necessary to install the driver on the CD that comes with the product. The card has a rear connector for auxiliary power (takes a floppy power plug), but my USB3 externals worked seamlessly without the extra power connection. The lowest price on ebay was substantially higher than this seller charged, even when shipping is considered. I placed two orders- one arrived in two days; the other shipment was delayed in the US postal system- seller answered questions quickly, extraordinarily courteous, and eager to help. What not to like!
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Used, but looks and works like new!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about buying used electronics. but this PCIe card came in the original box with all parts and instructions. This the second Rocketfish USB 3.0 I installed in this computer, plug and play, no extra power needed. Very satisfied. Harold S.
customer_reviews.author: Harold S.

customer_reviews.title: Economically Move Up to USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: The Rocketfish USB 3.0 PCI - Express card provides an inexpensive means to add USB 3.0 to your computer. The card worked as expected right out of the box. It is especially useful to me as I regularly edit and archive large video files. Before you order this item, make sure you have an available PCI-e slot.
customer_reviews.author: George Pfaffenberger

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me
customer_reviews.text: It did what it was supposed to do, both without the floppy disk power source and with it. I did not do any sophisticated ratings of speed in which I compared its throughput with US 2.0.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Working Great so Far
customer_reviews.text: So far this is working nice. Backing up to a external drive, I went from an average speed of 19.7MBps to around 47MBps. It is working so good I just ordered a second one. I have not tried it with an older USB 2.0 drive but I have heard they run a little faster as well.
customer_reviews.author: toms_jeep

customer_reviews.title: Rocketfish USB 3.0 PCI card works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I got this card to upgrade my Core i5 desktop to USB 3.0. This was a simple installation. After physically installing the card in the motherboard I went to the Rocketfish website to obtain the latest drivers. After installing the drivers it worked perfectly. I'm highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R. Sabovich

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Rocketfish USB 3.0 PCI Express Card is fast and easy to install. Product is a steal at this price. The packaging sucked, it looked like preschoolers where packing the card into the product box. The box also said it included CD with drivers but there was nothing on the box other that the card, but the drivers are easily found on their rocketfish website. Other than that great product, works well.
customer_reviews.author: J.Atilano

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.  Added USB 3 to my PC.
customer_reviews.text: This was quick to install, and the CD for drivers went without incident. I'm surprised Windows 7 didn't auto-load drivers for this, but running the driver from the CD was simple enough.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Blade

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly. No driver issues. Installed easily. Awesome value, especially if ordered here on Amazon. Highly recommended for any USB 3.0 application.
customer_reviews.author: vharmy

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Ubuntu 12.04 just picked it up, no drivers required. Power cable only needed if you will be charging devices from the port.
customer_reviews.author: Man From MI

customer_reviews.title: No problems.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my Gateway FX6901 desktop computer with no problems. Had to removed the telephone modem, which I never use, to make room for it. I had read a warning somewhere not to use the driver on the CD which came with it, so I downloaed the driver from the Rocketfish site. The installation was totally without problems. I had tried another brand of card previously but could not get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good USB 3.0 adapter
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily. Current drivers were included. Transferred files at 75-80mb/sec through my thumb drive. Cheap way to gain USB 3.0. for backup drives.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hantz

customer_reviews.title: Installed with no problems.  Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: My computer is running Vista. Installation of this card went without a hitch. Computer recognized it, installed the drivers and was up and running with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: PopBair

customer_reviews.title: computer slow down
customer_reviews.text: Ok i got this card and installed it and my computer actually slowed down i believe this to be the fault of me using a Pentium D my computer has Pci-e 2.0 but the processor it has is not fast enough i would recommend this card for core 2 duo or better only but nonetheless it does work i have a Toshiba external USB 3.0 hard drive attached and it does have higher transfer rates but only that does UPDATE 11/21/13: i have readded this card to my computer after a ram upgrade and my computer performance is no longer hurt.
customer_reviews.author: aaron burns

customer_reviews.title: All systems go
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for my Dell XPS, and sure enough works as expected. I think this is a good brand, so expect to have it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Put these in a couple of computers and they are up and running in no time.I bought used and they were as good as new ones.
customer_reviews.author: K. Palfi

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. The price is more reasonable comparing to other brands. Atto showed 3 times faster than USB2. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Works, and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Pros: I got this for ~$6 (refurb) gives you two usb ports that are faster than USB2, but not USB3 speeds really Cons: the first one that arrived not only didnt work, but fried my external usb sound card. They sent me a replacement card but did not replace the soundcard Floppy pin plug in is crappy (but isn't required) Works, but not for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: works, you need 4 ports
customer_reviews.text: it works. the only thing is, I wish I had got four ports instead of two. I don't know it this is a switch or hub.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling C.

customer_reviews.title: Rocket fast ports
customer_reviews.text: easy to install works great I would recommend this 2 port device to anyone looking for good price & easy to Install
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Lounsbury

customer_reviews.title: average speed of 70 MBps
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if its this card, my computer, my new hard drive cable, or a combination of all three that i get such speeds. I expected faster speeds. bought refurbished item,. seems to be working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Victor K

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: Install the card and install the driver from rocketfish website.It work on my win 7 32 bit.Not a bad card as it cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Neo

customer_reviews.title: Easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily, no problems, does what I need it to do. I would buy it again. Windows 7 32-bit system.
customer_reviews.author: David Tanks

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: It does its job. What more can I say. It's USB 3. My only problem is that my PC might not have a fast enough bus to reach full USB 3 speeds, but is it still fast none the less.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bauer

product_meta.title: Rocketfish USB 3.0 PCI Express Card RF-P2USB3
product_meta.description: This PCI Express interface card adds SuperSpeed USB 3.0 functionality to your PC and is backward compatible with USB 2.0 and 1.1 devices for additional connection options.
feature_bullets: ALWAYS FREE SHIPPING WITHIN THE USA

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars30 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
